page.title: 10MAKING CREELS
page.content: To make a creel,take slats of wood nailed together to make a rectangle. Next drill holes in each corner and half way down.Cut wire and bend it so each end fits the hole.After that put wooden pins across,one at each side and another on the top.Cover this with a piece of nylon rope netting.When you have laced that on put in{entrances.}A {double parlour creel}has 2 entrances. The first where the lobster enters is a {softeye}.In the next chamber is the{ringeye.}To keep the creel on the sea bed it is weighted with 70lbs of concrete.Before putting it in the sea,attach a rope with a buoy on the end.This marks where the creel is,and the rope is used to haul up the creel.
